oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three-quarter legth tintype of Frederick Claybrooke. It is set in a hinged oval case. The text states that he was killed at Hoover's Gap while leading his regiment into battle.

The Battle of Hoover's Gap was the opening battle of the Tullahoma Campaign. On June 24, 1863, Union General Williams Rosecrans, hoping to capitalize on the victory at Stones River, dispatched forces to Hoover's Gap. There, the Federals-including John T. Wilder's Lightning Brigade-quickly drove the defenders out. Fighting continued until June 26.
